results.name: Square array A(n,k) of numbers of length n quaternary words with at least k 0-digits between any other digits (n,k >= 0), read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
formula: A(n,k) = 4^n if k=0, else A(n,k) = 3*n+1 if n<=k+1, else A(n,k) = A(n-1,k) + 3*A(n-k-1,k).
example: A (3,1) = 19, because 19 quaternary words of length 3 have at least 1 0-digit between any other digits: 000, 001, 002, 003, 010, 020, 030, 100, 101, 102, 103, 200, 201, 202, 203, 300, 301, 301, 303.
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; if k=0 then 4^n elif n<=k+1 then 3*n+1 else A(n-1, k) +3*A(n-k-1, k) fi end: seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..13);
mathematica: a[n_, 0] := 4^n; a[n_, k_] /; n <= k+1 := 3*n+1; a[n_, k_] := a[n, k] = a[n-1, k] + 3*a[n-k-1, k]; Table[a[n-k, k], {n, 0, 13}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 15 2014, after Maple *)
